title: Spurious messages are garbled/displayed as code.
content: Some messages appear garbled/appear as code only: Some appear correctly at first, then at a subsequent reading, they have become garbled. Some messages suddenly (not on the initial reading, but on subsequent readings) have an erroneous Subject or Sender, and I recognize the (often garbled) content as belonging to another Subject or Sender. The problem is spurious: For instance, most e-mails from a particular Sender will read correctly, but every now and again a message appears garbled. When this happens, the From and Subject field will be empty when I open the message. (See attached images) These errors began when my e-mail provider Telenor (@online.no) started to upgrade their e-mail service a few months ago, and so far, they have not been able to pinpoint the cause or correct the problem. But all messages appear correctly on the server, so I suspect TB is not able to fetch and sort messages correctly. As a possible workaround: Is there a way to re-download a particular message to get a "clean" version of that particular message in TB? (I use TB version 102.11.2, Build ID 20230526152851). Thanks for your help :)
creator: gelgjo

creator: g.semeraro

title: Fontsize problem using KDE Plasma 5.27
content:
Hi, I noticed the fontsize of the `mainline` Thunderbird 102.12.0 is quite different (very much too small) on KDE Plasma 5.27.5 since my upgrade to Debian Bookworm. Basically the machine is a default Debian Bookworm installation. Changing the `layout.css.devPixelsPerPx` value didn't result in the expected behavior. Interestingly `mainline` Firefox / GTK based / Qt based applications are not affected and the problem (too small fontsize) is only there for Thunderbird.

I managed to find a workaround setting ``` GDK_DPI_SCALE=1.2 GDK_SCALE=1 ``` only for thunderbird e.g. by invoking it via ``` GDK_DPI_SCALE=1.2 GDK_SCALE=1 thunderbird ``` in the `.desktop` file.
creator: merkle.alexander

title: Strange Thunderbird Bug - Duplicating Just A Few Very Old Emails In Various Folders After Thunderbird Is Left Running For An Hour Or More
content:
Strange Thunderbird Bug - Duplicating Just A Few Very Old Emails In Multiple Folders After Thunderbird Is Left Running For An Hour Or More

Hi all at Mozilla,

For about the past year I've been experiencing a strange bug that happens only after Thunderbird is left running for more than an hour.

In a seemingly random manner, Thunderbird is duplicating (possibly by re-downloading) a small number of emails (between 2 and 10) in various folders and subfolders. The duplicates are nearly always quite old (several months or even years). When Thunderbird does this there are always exactly two of each duplicate (never one).

I can't tell if the problem has something to do with filters or actual redundant server downloads.

I think this problem has occurred with both Pop and Imap accounts, but I've primarily noticed it in Pop accounts.

I run: Windows 7 Pro OS Thunderbird 102.11.0 (32-bit) on: Sonic.net Internet service

This is not a huge problem but it is an irritating interruption to getting work done smoothly.

Thanks,

Eric Brooks
creator: brookse321
